page.title: 10 Village Halls
page.content: {Wickham St.Paul Village Hall}used to be in the Rectory grounds.However when the village lost its Rector his house was sold and the village hall became inaccessible.The village decided to build a new hall on the Village Green, and had two medieval fairs to raise the money. The hall and adjoining cricket pavilion were built by a local firm and opened in Jubilee Year-a wonderful community effort! {Great Maplestead Hall}is much older. In 1888 a meeting was held to start a Village Club and Reading Room.The land and building were given by Mr.T.Miller and two members of the Cracknell family were on the initial committee.Mr.Len Cracknell is the present secretary of the Village Hall Council.The club was first for men but in 1921 it developed into a Village Hall for all local activities.
